biotools.summary: RNSCLC-PRSP software to predict the prognostic risk and survival in patients with resected T1-3N0-2 M0 non-small cell lung cancer | Background:The clinical outcomes of patients with resected T1-3N0-2M0 non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with the same tumor-node-metastasis (TNM) stage are diverse. Although other prognostic factors and prognostic prediction tools have been reported in many published studies, a convenient, accurate and specific prognostic prediction software for clinicians has not been developed. The purpose of our research was to develop this type of software that can analyze subdivided T and N staging and additional factors to predict prognostic risk and the corresponding mean and median survival time and 1-5-year survival rates of patients with resected T1-3N0-2M0 NSCLC. Results:Using a Cox proportional hazard regression model, we determined the independent prognostic factors and obtained a prognostic index (PI) eq

bioschemas.name: RNSCLC-PRSP software

The purpose of our research was to develop this type of software that can analyze subdivided T and N staging and additional factors to predict prognostic risk and the corresponding mean and median survival time and 1-5-year survival rates of patients with resected T1-3N0-2M0 NSCLC.
